name: Bit
intro: The smallest unit of digital storage, describing the single 0/1 state of binary data, adapted for measuring network transmission rates.

name: Byte
intro: The basic unit of digital storage, the core benchmark for measuring file size and memory capacity.

name: Kilobyte
intro: Decimal small storage unit, the standard of hard disk manufacturers, adapted for measuring small text and image files.

name: Megabyte
intro: Common decimal unit, marked on hard disks and USB flash drives, adapted for measuring ordinary images and documents.

name: Gigabyte
intro: Mainstream decimal unit, the core measurement standard for hard disks, memory cards, and broadband traffic.

name: Terabyte
intro: Decimal large-capacity unit, the mainstream measurement standard for mechanical hard disks and server storage.

name: Petabyte
intro: Decimal ultra-large-scale unit, the measurement standard for data centers, cloud storage, and enterprise-level storage.

name: Exabyte
intro: Decimal massive storage unit, adapted for measuring the data volume of Internet giants and national-level data centers.

name: Zettabyte
intro: Decimal extreme storage unit, describing the total global Internet data volume and large-scale scientific research databases.

name: Yottabyte
intro: Top decimal storage unit, only used for theoretical data volume and global data volume estimation.

name: Kibibyte
intro: Binary small unit, the operating system standard, adapted for measuring system files and memory usage.

name: Mebibyte
intro: Common binary unit, the core measurement standard for operating system memory and process usage.

name: Gibibyte
intro: Mainstream binary unit, the display standard for operating system hard disk capacity and memory capacity.

name: Tebibyte
intro: Binary large-capacity unit, the operating system measurement standard for server memory and enterprise-level storage.

name: Pebibyte
intro: Binary ultra-large-scale unit, the operating system measurement standard for cloud servers and large-scale databases.

name: Exbibyte
intro: Binary massive unit, adapted for measuring ultra-large-scale data centers and global distributed storage systems.
